symptoms: dyspnea with normal pulmonary function tests

diagnoses: description: A condition where tissue similar to the lining of the uterus grows outside of the uterus, causing pain, irregular bleeding, and potential fertility issues.}, {diagnosis: Autoimmune disorder (e.g., Lupus, Rheumatoid Arthritis)
description: A condition where the immune system mistakenly attacks the bodys own tissues, potentially causing joint pain, fatigue, anemia, and other symptoms.}, {diagnosis: Fibromyalgia
description: A disorder characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain accompanied by fatigue, sleep, mood, and memory issues.}, {diagnosis: Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)

description: A group of disorders that cause chronic inflammation of the digestive tract, potentially leading to pain, diarrhea, fatigue, anemia, and other complications.}, {diagnosis: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome (CFS)

description: A debilitating disorder characterized by persistent and overwhelming fatigue that is not relieved by rest, often accompanied by other symptoms like muscle and joint pain, cognitive difficulties, and sleep problems.}, {diagnosis: Vitamin Deficiency (e.g., Iron, Vitamin D)

description: Insufficient levels of essential vitamins in the body, potentially leading to anemia, fatigue, muscle weakness, and other health issues.}, {diagnosis: Mental Health Disorder (e.g., Major Depressive Disorder)

description: Conditions affecting mood, thinking, and behavior, potentially leading to symptoms like sadness, hopelessness, fatigue, and physical pain.}, {diagnosis: Infection (e.g., Viral, Bacterial)
description: Invasion and multiplication of microorganisms in the body, potentially causing a wide range of symptoms including fever, fatigue, pain, and swollen lymph nodes.}, {diagnosis: Lymphoma
description: A type of cancer that affects the lymphatic system, potentially causing swollen lymph nodes, fatigue, anemia, and other symptoms.}, {diagnosis: Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID)
description: An infection of the female reproductive organs, potentially causing pain, irregular bleeding, and other complications.}
